Posts.Content: blackhotflame wrote: I dont have a pcp right now, I was sent from the ER to have it done the next say, because it was an er doctor who refferend they dont get the results of this to explain it, I have to figure it out  It states..... Findings: The patient reports pain in the upper outer quadrants of the breast bilaterally. The entire breasts were scanned bilaterally. The right breast demonstrates thick fibroglandular tissue from 9 to 12 o'clock position and essentially the are of concern. A hypoechoic nodule is seen in the 5 o'clock position measuring 4 mm in diameter. This has a slight nodularity to the surface. The nodile is otherwise almost perfectly spherical. No significant shadowing is produced by this nodule.  IMPRESSION: 1. the region of concern on this study was pain in the upper outer quadrants. This area in the breast bilatteraly demonstrate dense fibroglandular tisses with no worrisome focal abnormalities. 2. In the 5 o'clock position in the right breast a small 4mm solid nodule is identified. This has a slightly irregular surface pattern. This is categorized as a greater than 2% risk of malignancy, and biopsy should be concidered. 3. BIRADS Category 4a- Midly suspicious lesion; biopsy is recomended Can someone help me depict what is says please, I'm pregnant and have great fears that something may go wrong. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I dont have a PCP,Im trying to figure out the results myself... blackhotflame momzybaby
